128.5: In this study, knit polyester fabric treated with combination of chitosan and polyaniline could obtain the most remarkable durable hydrophobicity among all the samples from Fig. 3 and the corresponding contact angle could reach to a desirable level (128.5±2.7°) as a hydrophobic textile, furthermore, thus modified fabric could also preserve reasonable hydrophobic properties (122.6±3.2°) even after laundering (Table 1 ).

Furthermore, the nanocomposite coated sample performed better and durable water-repellent properties than pristine chitosan coated case, the corresponding contact angle could reach to a desirable level (128.5±2.7°) as a hydrophobic textile, which could be attributed to both the coupling hydrophobic properties of chitosan and the nano-structures lotus leaf of polyaniline with enhancing surface roughness.
